text: Atlanta season 3 episode 4, which I just watched, is brilliant. There's one point in the episode when a white man explains slavery from the point of view of today's blacks, and you realize as it makes sense, the words were probably from a black writer. The power of being able to have the ideas you want white people to understand come from the mouth of a white actor. They get to insert their truth into the script the way Woody Allen inserts Marshall McLuhan into the script of Annie Hall.
